bio:treatment.description: Plants large to very large, yellowish green, <to 80 cm, often very robust, densely hairy, hairs patent, soft>. Stems densely spreading-hairy (to inflorescences). Leaves: stipules translucent, usually pale pink proximally, <lobes turning brownish>; blade orbiculate or reniform-orbiculate, 9–11-lobed, margins flat or slightly undulate, basal sinuses narrow to almost closed, <basal lobes sometimes overlapping>, middle lobes <with lateral sides convex or slightly concave at base>, shorter than to as long as their half-widths; incisions absent; teeth slightly connivent or not, ± symmetric, apex acute or subacute, surfaces densely hairy throughout. Inflorescences: primary branches densely hairy; <peduncles pubescent or almost glabrous>. Pedicels glabrous. Flowers: epicalyx bractlet lengths 1 times sepals (as wide), <often with blunt teeth, glabrous; epicalyx bractlets and sepals patent after flowering, giving appearance of an 8-point star>; hypanthium usually densely, occasionally sparsely, hairy (in proximal 1/2). Achenes exserted from discs (distinctly longer than hypanthia).
